pages.text: "As tempting as it may be, don't jump into a TEP filled with water, the water won't save you from fall damage."$(p)The Thermal Evaporation Plant (TEP) is a 4x4 base multiblock for producing concentrated solutions by evaporating their water contents using heat energy. Minimum height of a TEP is 3 blocks tall.$(p)Heat can be supplied via
Advanced Solar Generators, heaters, Fusion Reactor, heat generators, or Thermodynamic Conductors. Note that heat is inputted through a Thermal Evaporation Valve.$(p)Size limit: 4x4x18

$(bold)Blocks that will be required:$()$(li)Thermal Evaporation Block $(li)Thermal Evaporation Controller $(li)Thermal Evaporation Valve $(li)Structural Glass (optional) $(li)Reactor Glass (optional) $(li)Advanced Solar Generators (optional)

pages.title: Construction Notes
pages.text: $(li)A TEP $(bold)MUST $()have one Thermal Evaporation Controller.$(li)The top four corner blocks can be left empty or, if you prefer a rectangular style, can be TEP blocks.$(li2)The top four corner blocks can also be replaced with Advanced Solar Generators if you have Mekanism: Generators installed (which if you don't, what are you doing with your life?).

$(bold)Production information:$(br)$(bold)Max $()Production is based on height (A x 60 = Max Production (mB/t), where A is height). For example, a 13 blocks tall TEP would produce at a rate of 780mB/t.
